howItWorks.title: How to Convert Standard Form to Slope Intercept Form
howItWorks.description: Converting from standard form (Ax + By = C) to slope-intercept form (y = mx + b) involves solving for y. The slope equals -A/B and the y-intercept equals C/B.

tips: Always check that B ≠ 0 before converting - vertical lines cannot be written in slope-intercept form
Remember: slope = -A/B and y-intercept = C/B when converting from standard form
For horizontal lines (A = 0), the result simplifies to y = constant
Use this calculator to verify your manual calculations and avoid arithmetic errors
Practice with different coefficient combinations to master the conversion process
The calculator automatically handles fraction simplification and decimal conversions
